p:
In this analysis, we report interim observational data from an ongoing study of a PrEP intervention in 16 communities in three regions of eastern Africa with varying HIV prevalence among individuals aged 15 years or older: western Kenya (19%), eastern Uganda (4%), and western Uganda (7%).
9 As part of the second phase of the Sustainable East Africa Research in Community Health (SEARCH) study, we did population-level HIV testing and implemented a PrEP intervention
10 before national PrEP roll-out in Uganda and Kenya. The study population included adults (aged â‰¥15 years) in the SEARCH study. Here, we report an interim analysis up to 72 weeks of follow-up to address knowledge gaps in the population-level PrEP cascade in the context of roll-out and scale-up in the region.
